AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: Defendant convicted of aiding and abetting the transportation of undocumented aliens, whose vehicle was stopped and searched, and appellant in the case, requesting post-verdict discovery through juror depositions, owner of the truck and camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.GARWOOD: Circuit Judge presiding over the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper, driving the patrol car, did not testify to having reason to believe the vehicle came from the border, observed the truck and its occupants, had specialized experience and training, testified about passengers' behavior, received training in Spanish, and spoke and understood it to a limited extent. Observed a pickup truck camper traveling northbound unusually slowly on Interstate Highway 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfred Baron: United States Border Patrol agent involved in the traffic stop of a suspicious pickup truck camper, testified without contradiction about recent apprehensions of illegal alien smugglers near the location, observed the truck and its passengers, had specialized experience and training, shined flashlight into the truck cab, noted unusual speed, native Spanish speaker, participated in approximately 150 separate incidents in which arrests were made for transporting illegal aliens. Participated in the traffic stop on Interstate Highway 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron: Agents who jointly conducted the field investigation, observed the suspicious vehicle, and had reason to suspect the presence of illegal aliens in Garcia's vehicle based on various factors including the occupants' appearance and behavior. Conducted a traffic stop of a pickup truck camper on Interstate Highway 35
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lourdes Rangel-Campos: Driver of the camper, arrested by the agents for transporting undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Brignoni-Ponce: Namesake of a test regarding stops near the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.TATE: Circuit Judge dissenting in the appeal
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron as b: Involved in stopping a pickup truck with a heavily loaded camper attachment on an Interstate Highway in Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pena-Cantu: Reference in a legal case regarding factors supporting the reasonableness of a stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the district judge in the case: Believed the agents' undisputed testimony, presided over Garcia's trial and made decisions regarding jury instructions
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Orona-Sanchez: Involved in a previous ruling on passenger behavior during stops, distinguishable from Garcia's case due to differences in vehicle loading and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pacheco: Involved in a comparison of passenger conduct during stops, distinguishable from Garcia's case due to differences in vehicle loading and occupant behavior
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Lamas: Involved in a comparison of passenger conduct during stops, with more suspicious behavior than Pena-Cantu and Orona-Sanchez
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Garcia as camper owner: Owner of the camper involved in the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Garcia as owner of the stopped truck: Owner of the truck that was stopped by border patrol agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Pruszenski as witness who did not testif: Witness who testified about the traffic stop but did not have reason to believe the vehicle came from the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Baron as witness who did not testify to: Witness who testified about the traffic stop but did not have reason to believe the vehicle came from the border
